# Claude for Beginners — Desktop App v0.1.0

**Release Date:** 2026-02-18
**Status:** Internal Alpha
**Platform:** macOS (Electron + Next.js 16)

---

## Overview

First release of the Claude for Beginners desktop application. A guided, beginner-friendly Electron app that wraps Claude Code CLI to help non-technical users build websites through conversation. Supports Hebrew (RTL, default) and English.

---

## Features

### 1. Project Management

- **Automatic project creation** — creates a directory under `~/Documents/Claude Projects/<slug>/` with `git init`
- **Smart slug generation** — strips EN/HE stop words, takes first 3 meaningful words, deduplicates with `-2`, `-3` suffix
- **Persistent metadata** — project state (name, locale, vibe, sessionId, liveUrl) stored via `electron-store`
- **Project switcher** — welcome screen shows recent projects sorted by last opened, click to resume
- **Session resumption** — reopening a project restores the Claude session ID for continuity

### 2. Chat Interface

- **Activity block grouping** — consecutive tool calls merged into collapsible "building" blocks showing file count
- **Markdown rendering** — assistant messages rendered with `react-markdown` + `remark-gfm` (code blocks, links, lists)
- **Live activity bar** — animated status indicator during streaming (e.g., "Creating index.tsx...", "Installing packages...")
- **Chat persistence** — messages saved to `.cc4d/chat-history.json`, restored on app reopen
- **Conversation recovery banner** — auto-dismissing notification when a previous session is restored
- **Component architecture** — ChatPanel decomposed into UserMessage, AssistantMessage, BuildingBlock, ErrorMessage, ChatInput, ChatHistory, LiveActivityBar, ConversationRecoveryBanner

### 3. Agent Communication

- **SSE streaming** — real-time event parsing from Claude CLI via `/api/agent` route
- **Tool-aware status messages** — Bash, Write, Edit, git, shadcn commands produce friendly progress text
- **Session ID capture** — `onSessionId` callback persists session across restarts
- **Raw event forwarding** — `onRawEvent` callback feeds debug terminal
- **Locale-aware messages** — status text adapts to Hebrew/English

### 4. Guided Build Flow (cc4d Skill)

- **Skill bundling** — `skills/cc4d/` copied into project `.cc4d/` on creation
- **Progress tracking** — `.cc4d-progress.json` tracks completed steps
- **CLAUDE.md generation** — skill instructions written to project root, paths rewritten for local execution
- **Step indicator** — visual progress bar in build page header

### 5. Logging Infrastructure

- **4-file logging system** — electron.log, agent.log, app.log, renderer.log under `~/.claude-for-beginners/logs/`
- **Renderer log forwarding** — `console.error` and `console.warn` patched to forward to main process via IPC
- **Log rotation** — 5 MB max, 5 files rotation; electron.log uses `.old` backup
- **Dev convenience** — `npm run logs` tails all logs, `npm run debug:status` shows file sizes

### 6. Debug Tools

- **Debug terminal** — `Cmd+Shift+D` toggles overlay showing raw Claude CLI events
- **Color-coded events** — each event type (system, assistant, tool_use, result, error) has distinct color
- **Expandable rows** — click to see full JSON payload
- **Filtering** — text filter across all event fields
- **Auto-scroll** — follows latest events with manual override

### 7. Welcome Experience

- **Single-screen start** — simplified from multi-step onboarding to one-click "Start building!" button
- **Recent projects** — horizontal scrollable cards with relative timestamps ("just now", "yesterday", "3 days ago")
- **Bilingual UI** — full Hebrew RTL and English support with `next-intl`

### 8. Electron Shell

- **Window management** — 1200x800 default, 900x600 minimum, draggable title bar region
- **External links** — `shell:open-external` IPC handler for safe link opening
- **Bundled dependencies** — Node.js, Git (dugite), and cc4d skill packaged as extraResources
- **Auto DevTools** — developer tools open automatically in non-packaged builds

---

## Architecture

```
desktop/
├── electron/
│   ├── main.js              # Electron main process (IPC, window, project mgmt)
│   ├── preload.js           # Context bridge (window.electronAPI)
│   ├── preload.ts           # Type declarations for electronAPI
│   ├── project-store.js     # electron-store wrapper for project metadata
│   └── project-utils.js     # slugifyIdea, deduplicatePath helpers
├── src/
│   ├── app/
│   │   ├── api/agent/route.ts   # Next.js API route → Claude CLI spawn
│   │   ├── welcome/page.tsx     # Project selection / creation
│   │   ├── build/page.tsx       # Main chat + build interface
│   │   └── ship/page.tsx        # Deployment flow
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── chat/                # 9 chat sub-components
│   │   ├── debug/               # Debug terminal overlay
│   │   ├── brand/               # Logo, LanguageToggle
│   │   └── progress/            # StepIndicator, PhaseLabel
│   └── lib/
│       ├── store.ts             # Zustand state (messages, project, streaming)
│       ├── agent-client.ts      # SSE client + event parser
│       ├── activity-blocks.ts   # Message → activity block grouping
│       ├── use-chat-persistence.ts  # Load/save hook
│       ├── renderer-logger.ts   # Console patching for log forwarding
│       ├── debug-store.ts       # Debug terminal state
│       └── use-debug-shortcut.ts    # Cmd+Shift+D handler
├── messages/
│   ├── en.json                  # English translations
│   └── he.json                  # Hebrew translations
└── __tests__/                   # Unit, component, and E2E tests
```

---

## Dependencies Added (since initial commit)

| Package | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `react-markdown` | Markdown rendering in assistant messages |
| `remark-gfm` | GitHub-flavored markdown (tables, strikethrough) |
| `vitest` | Unit + component test runner |
| `@vitest/coverage-v8` | Code coverage |
| `@testing-library/react` | Component testing utilities |
| `@testing-library/jest-dom` | DOM assertion matchers |
| `@testing-library/user-event` | User interaction simulation |
| `@playwright/test` | E2E browser testing |
| `jsdom` | DOM environment for tests |

---

## Known Limitations (v0.1.0)

1. **macOS only** — no Windows/Linux testing or packaging yet
2. **No live preview** — browser preview panel removed in favor of single-column chat
3. **No deployment integration** — ship page exists but deployment flow not wired to a provider
4. **No auto-update** — no electron-updater configured
5. **No code signing** — macOS builds will trigger Gatekeeper warnings
6. **Claude CLI required** — expects `~/.local/bin/claude` to be installed separately
7. **Port conflict** — Next.js dev server on 3456 may conflict if not cleaned up on exit
8. **No offline mode** — requires internet for Claude CLI communication

---

## Build & Run

```bash
cd desktop
npm install
npm run dev          # Dev mode (Next.js + Electron)
npm run package      # Production build (macOS)
```

---

## What's Next (v0.2.0 candidates)

- Live browser preview (split pane or floating window)
- Vercel/Netlify deployment integration
- Auto-update via electron-updater
- Windows + Linux support
- Project rename / delete from UI
- Import existing project directory
- Onboarding tutorial / tooltips

   185→| D1 | Electron logs | Run app, check `~/.claude-for-beginners/logs/electron.log` | Contains app lifecycle events, IPC calls |
   186→| D2 | Agent logs | Send a message, check `agent.log` | Contains Claude CLI spawn and streaming events |
   187→| D3 | Renderer logs | Trigger console.error in devtools, check `renderer.log` | Error forwarded and logged |
   188→| D4 | Log rotation | Fill logs past 5 MB | Old file rotated to `.1`, new file started |
   189→| D5 | npm run logs | Run `npm run logs` in terminal | Tails all 4 log files |
   190→
   191→### E. Debug Tools
   192→

   194→|---|----------|-------|-----------------|
   195→| E1 | Toggle debug terminal | Press `Cmd+Shift+D` | Debug overlay appears at bottom 40% of screen |

   207→| F3 | Language toggle | Click language toggle in header | Locale switches, UI updates immediately |
   208→| F4 | Status messages | Observe build status in both locales | Tool activity messages shown in correct language |
   209→
   210→### G. Edge Cases
   211→
   212→| # | Scenario | Steps | Expected Result |
   213→|---|----------|-------|-----------------|
   214→| G1 | Port conflict | Start app while port 3456 is in use | Graceful error or alternate port |
   215→| G2 | No Claude CLI | Remove/rename `~/.local/bin/claude`, send message | Error message displayed, not a crash |
   216→| G3 | Disk full | Fill disk, try to create project | Error handled gracefully |

# Claude for Beginners — v0.1.0 Testing Plan

**Version:** 0.1.0
**Date:** 2026-02-18

---

## Test Infrastructure

### Automated Tests

| Type | Runner | Config | Command |
|------|--------|--------|---------|
| Unit tests | Vitest | `vitest.config.ts` | `npm test` |
| Component tests | Vitest + Testing Library | `vitest.config.ts` | `npm test` |
| E2E tests | Playwright | `playwright.config.ts` | `npm run test:e2e` |
| Coverage | v8 via Vitest | — | `npm run test:coverage` |
| All CI | Vitest + Playwright | — | `npm run test:ci` |

### Test Files

```
__tests__/
├── setup/
│   ├── vitest.setup.tsx         # Global mocks (next-intl, next/navigation, framer-motion)
│   └── mocks/
│       ├── electron-api.ts      # Mock window.electronAPI (all IPC methods)
│       ├── electron.ts          # Mock electron module (app, ipcMain, BrowserWindow)
│       └── electron-store.ts    # In-memory electron-store mock
├── unit/
│   ├── agent-client.test.ts         # parseAgentEvent (20+ cases)
│   ├── agent-client-connect.test.ts # connectToAgent (9 cases)
│   ├── store.test.ts                # Zustand store (10+ cases)
│   └── project-utils.test.js        # slugifyIdea, deduplicatePath (10+ cases)
├── components/
│   └── ChatPanel.test.tsx           # ChatPanel rendering (7 cases)
└── e2e/
    └── full-flow.spec.ts            # Page load smoke tests (4 cases)
```

---

## Unit Test Coverage

### Agent Client — `parseAgentEvent` (agent-client.test.ts)

| # | Test Case | Status |
|---|-----------|--------|
| 1 | Returns null for system events | Automated |
| 2 | Returns null for rate_limit events | Automated |
| 3 | Returns null for user events | Automated |
| 4 | Parses assistant text content (EN) | Automated |
| 5 | Parses assistant text content (HE) | Automated |
| 6 | Parses Bash tool_use with known command (npm install) | Automated |
| 7 | Parses Bash tool_use with unknown command | Automated |
| 8 | Parses Write tool_use — extracts filename | Automated |
| 9 | Parses Edit tool_use — extracts filename | Automated |
| 10 | Parses Glob tool_use | Automated |
| 11 | Parses Grep tool_use | Automated |
| 12 | Parses Read tool_use | Automated |
| 13 | Parses generic/unknown tool_use | Automated |
| 14 | Parses successful result event | Automated |
| 15 | Parses error result event | Automated |
| 16 | Parses error event type | Automated |
| 17 | Returns null for unknown event types | Automated |
| 18 | Handles git init command | Automated |
| 19 | Handles git commit command | Automated |
| 20 | Handles npx shadcn command | Automated |
| 21 | Handles mkdir command | Automated |

### Agent Client — `connectToAgent` (agent-client-connect.test.ts)

| # | Test Case | Status |
|---|-----------|--------|
| 1 | Sends correct POST body (prompt, locale, projectDir, sessionId) | Automated |
| 2 | Parses SSE data lines and calls onMessage | Automated |
| 3 | Calls onDone on `[DONE]` marker | Automated |
| 4 | Calls onDone on stream end (no [DONE]) | Automated |
| 5 | Calls onError on HTTP error response | Automated |
| 6 | Calls onError on network failure | Automated |
| 7 | Ignores AbortError (user-initiated cancel) | Automated |
| 8 | Captures session_id and calls onSessionId | Automated |
| 9 | abort() calls AbortController.abort() | Automated |

### Store (store.test.ts)

| # | Test Case | Status |
|---|-----------|--------|
| 1 | Initial state has all default values | Automated |
| 2 | setLocale updates locale | Automated |
| 3 | addMessage appends to messages array | Automated |
| 4 | setStreaming updates isStreaming flag | Automated |
| 5 | setProjectDir updates projectDir | Automated |
| 6 | setSessionId updates sessionId | Automated |
| 7 | loadProject bulk-sets fields and resets transient state | Automated |
| 8 | reset() restores all defaults | Automated |
| 9 | loadMessages sets messages and messagesLoaded flag | Automated |
| 10 | setCurrentActivity updates activity string | Automated |
| 11 | Persistence includes correct keys in partialize | Automated |

### Project Utils (project-utils.test.js)

| # | Test Case | Status |
|---|-----------|--------|
| 1 | Strips English stop words | Automated |
| 2 | Strips Hebrew stop words | Automated |
| 3 | Takes first 3 meaningful words | Automated |
| 4 | Handles special characters / non-ASCII | Automated |
| 5 | Lowercases output | Automated |
| 6 | Falls back to "my-project" for empty input | Automated |
| 7 | Handles single-word ideas | Automated |
| 8 | deduplicatePath returns original if no collision | Automated |
| 9 | deduplicatePath appends -2 on first collision | Automated |
| 10 | deduplicatePath increments counter for multiple collisions | Automated |

---

## Component Test Coverage

### ChatPanel (ChatPanel.test.tsx)

| # | Test Case | Status |
|---|-----------|--------|
| 1 | Renders ChatHistory, ChatInput, LiveActivityBar | Automated |
| 2 | Shows ConversationRecoveryBanner when showRecoveryBanner=true | Automated |
| 3 | Hides recovery banner when showRecoveryBanner=false | Automated |
| 4 | Disables input while streaming | Automated |
| 5 | Calls onSend with message text on submit | Automated |
| 6 | Clears input field after send | Automated |
| 7 | Does not send empty messages | Automated |

---

## E2E Test Coverage

### Page Load Smoke Tests (full-flow.spec.ts)

| # | Test Case | Status |
|---|-----------|--------|
| 1 | Home page (/) loads without error | Automated |
| 2 | Setup page (/setup) loads without error | Automated |
| 3 | Welcome page (/welcome) loads without error | Automated |
| 4 | Build page (/build) loads without error | Automated |

---

## Manual Test Plan

### A. First Launch Flow

| # | Scenario | Steps | Expected Result |
|---|----------|-------|-----------------|
| A1 | Fresh start | Launch app with no prior projects | Welcome page shows mascot + "Start building!" button, no recent projects |
| A2 | Create project | Click "Start building!" | Project dir created at `~/Documents/Claude Projects/new-project/`, `.cc4d/` folder present, `.git/` initialized, navigates to `/build` |
| A3 | Verify project structure | Check created directory | Contains `.cc4d/scripts/`, `.cc4d/chat-history.json` (after first message), `CLAUDE.md`, `.cc4d-progress.json` |
| A4 | Agent starts | Observe build page after creation | Chat shows streaming activity, live activity bar animates |

### B. Chat Interface

| # | Scenario | Steps | Expected Result |
|---|----------|-------|-----------------|
| B1 | Send message | Type text in input, press Enter or click send | Message appears as right-aligned user bubble |
| B2 | Receive response | Wait for agent response | Assistant message shows as left-aligned white bubble with mascot avatar |
| B3 | Markdown rendering | Agent sends markdown (code, links, lists) | Rendered correctly with syntax highlighting and clickable links |
| B4 | Building blocks | Agent runs multiple tool calls | Consecutive tool calls grouped into collapsible building block with file count |
| B5 | Expand building block | Click on collapsed building block | Expands to show individual status messages |
| B6 | Live activity bar | While agent is streaming | Bottom bar shows current activity with spinner |
| B7 | Error handling | Agent encounters error | Red error pill displayed, auto-retry message shown |
| B8 | External links | Click link in assistant message | Opens in system browser via `shell:open-external` |

### C. Project Persistence

| # | Scenario | Steps | Expected Result |
|---|----------|-------|-----------------|
| C1 | Chat persistence | Build a project, quit app, reopen | Chat history restored, recovery banner shown briefly |
| C2 | Session resumption | Quit mid-build, reopen, select project | Agent resumes with same session ID |
| C3 | Recent projects | Create 2+ projects, return to welcome | Both projects shown as cards with correct names and timestamps |
| C4 | Project switch | Click different project card | Navigates to build page with correct project loaded |
| C5 | Display name fallback | Project with empty displayName | Shows slug-based name instead |

### D. Logging

| # | Scenario | Steps | Expected Result |
|---|----------|-------|-----------------|
| D1 | Electron logs | Run app, check `~/.claude-for-beginners/logs/electron.log` | Contains app lifecycle events, IPC calls |
| D2 | Agent logs | Send a message, check `agent.log` | Contains Claude CLI spawn and streaming events |
| D3 | Renderer logs | Trigger console.error in devtools, check `renderer.log` | Error forwarded and logged |
| D4 | Log rotation | Fill logs past 5 MB | Old file rotated to `.1`, new file started |
| D5 | npm run logs | Run `npm run logs` in terminal | Tails all 4 log files |

### E. Debug Tools

| # | Scenario | Steps | Expected Result |
|---|----------|-------|-----------------|
| E1 | Toggle debug terminal | Press `Cmd+Shift+D` | Debug overlay appears at bottom 40% of screen |
| E2 | Raw events | Send message with debug terminal open | Events stream in real-time with color-coded types |
| E3 | Expand event | Click on an event row | Full JSON payload shown |
| E4 | Filter events | Type in filter box | Only matching events shown |
| E5 | Close terminal | Press `Cmd+Shift+D` again | Overlay hides |

### F. i18n

| # | Scenario | Steps | Expected Result |
|---|----------|-------|-----------------|
| F1 | Hebrew mode | Set locale to Hebrew | All UI text in Hebrew, layout RTL |
| F2 | English mode | Toggle to English | All UI text in English, layout LTR |
| F3 | Language toggle | Click language toggle in header | Locale switches, UI updates immediately |
| F4 | Status messages | Observe build status in both locales | Tool activity messages shown in correct language |

### G. Edge Cases

| # | Scenario | Steps | Expected Result |
|---|----------|-------|-----------------|
| G1 | Port conflict | Start app while port 3456 is in use | Graceful error or alternate port |
| G2 | No Claude CLI | Remove/rename `~/.local/bin/claude`, send message | Error message displayed, not a crash |
| G3 | Disk full | Fill disk, try to create project | Error handled gracefully |
| G4 | Project dir deleted | Delete project folder externally, try to switch to it | Error handled, project not loaded |
| G5 | Rapid messages | Send multiple messages quickly | Previous request aborted, latest processed |
| G6 | Very long message | Send a 5000+ character message | Message renders without layout break |
| G7 | Network disconnect | Lose network mid-stream | Error message shown, can retry |

---

## Running Tests

```bash
# All unit + component tests
npm test

# Watch mode (re-runs on file changes)
npm run test:watch

# With coverage report
npm run test:coverage

# E2E only (requires dev server running)
npm run test:e2e

# Full CI suite
npm run test:ci

# Specific test file
npx vitest run __tests__/unit/store.test.ts
```

---

## Test Environment Requirements

- **Node.js** 20+
- **macOS** (Electron requires macOS for Mac builds)
- **Claude CLI** installed at `~/.local/bin/claude` (for E2E agent tests)
- **Port 3456** available (Next.js dev server)

---

## Acceptance Criteria for v0.1.0

- [ ] All automated tests pass (`npm run test:ci`)
- [ ] App launches without error on macOS
- [ ] Can create a new project from welcome page
- [ ] Chat messages send and receive correctly
- [ ] Chat history persists across app restarts
- [ ] Recent projects appear on welcome page
- [ ] Can switch between projects
- [ ] Logging works (all 4 log files written)
- [ ] Debug terminal toggles with keyboard shortcut
- [ ] Hebrew and English locales work correctly
- [ ] `npm run package` produces a working .app bundle

1→# Voice Guide — "SOUL"
     2→
     3→This is the voice of the product. Every user-facing string — greeting, error, celebration, feedback request — should sound like it came from the same person: warm, direct, a little self-deprecating, never preachy.
     4→
     5→Inspired by Shaul Amsterdamsky's writing style: like someone talking to you across a cafe table in Jerusalem. Not a textbook. Not a startup pitch deck. A person.
     6→
     7→---
     8→
     9→## 9 Voice Principles
    10→
    11→1. **Write like you talk.** Spoken register. Fragments OK. Trail-offs OK. If you wouldn't say it out loud to a friend, rewrite it.
    12→2. **Action first, poetry second.** Do the thing, then comment on it. Never explain what you're about to explain.
    13→3. **Honest deflation.** Build a moment up, then ground it. "Your site is live. On the actual internet. I know, I'm surprised too."
    14→4. **Self-deprecating, never user-deprecating.** You're the butt of the joke. The user is never dumb, slow, or wrong.
    15→5. **Singular address.** "You" not "you guys". "אתה/את" not "אתם". This is a 1:1 conversation.
    16→6. **Concrete over abstract.** Name the thing. "I changed the button color" not "I made some visual adjustments."
    17→7. **Short sentences.** If a sentence has a comma, consider splitting it. If it has two commas, definitely split it.
    18→8. **Framing is everything.** An error is not a failure — it's "whoops, give me a sec." Shipping is not a technical process — it's "putting this on the internet so anyone can see it."
    19→9. **No jargon, no filler.** No "leverage", "utilize", "in order to", "it's important to note that". Say it plain.
    20→
    21→---
    22→
    23→## Do's and Don'ts
    24→
    25→### Do
    26→
    27→- Use "Hey" not "Hello" or "Welcome"
    28→- Admit when something broke: "Whoops" / "אופס"
    29→- Celebrate simply: "That's it. You have a website." not "Congratulations on your achievement!"
    30→- Ask for feedback directly: "What do you think?" not "Please provide your feedback"
    31→- Use food/everyday metaphors when they fit naturally
    32→- End with the point, not with pleasantries
    33→
    34→### Don't
    35→
    36→- Start with "I'm excited to..." or "I'd be happy to..."
    37→- Use exclamation marks more than once per message
    38→- Say "simply" or "just" before instructions (it patronizes)
    39→- Hedge with "I think maybe perhaps..." — be direct, be honest
    40→- Use corporate plural: "we" when you mean "I"
    41→- Over-celebrate. A first build is cool. It's not a moon landing.
    42→
    43→---
    44→
    45→## Hebrew-Specific Guidance
    46→
    47→Register: casual spoken Hebrew. Think how a smart friend who happens to know code would text you.
    48→
    49→- **"יאללה"** — great for starting actions. Natural, not forced.
    50→- **"תכלס"** — perfect for cutting through fluff. "תכלס, מה אתה צריך?"
    51→- **"נו"** — for prompting feedback. "נו, מה אתה אומר?"
    52→- **Food metaphors** — "זה כמו לפתוח מסעדה — קודם תפריט, אחר כך עיצוב"
    53→- **Singular address always** — "אתה/את", "שלך", "בא לך", never "אתם/שלכם/בא לכם"
    54→- **Contractions** — "מה בא לך" not "מה ברצונך"
    55→- **Keep it warm** — Hebrew can sound harsh in short sentences. Add "נו" or "אחי" energy without literally saying "אחי".
    56→
    57→---
    58→
    59→## English-Specific Guidance
    60→
    61→Register: casual smart friend. Not startup bro. Not customer support bot.
    62→
    63→- **Contractions always** — "I'll", "you'd", "that's", not "I will", "you would"
    64→- **"Hey" not "Hi there!"** — one word greetings
    65→- **Rhetorical questions** — "Want to put this on the internet?" not "Would you like to deploy?"
    66→- **Trail-offs** — "Give me a sec..." (the ... is intentional, conveys thinking)
    67→- **Understated celebration** — "For real." "Let that sink in." not "Amazing! Wonderful! Great job!"
    68→
    69→---
    70→
    71→## Phrase Examples
    72→
    73→### Greeting (Step 2 — Orient)
    74→
    75→| Context | English | Hebrew |
    76→|---------|---------|--------|
    77→| First greeting | Hey! Got an idea for a site? Tell me what you're picturing and I'll build it. You talk, I code. | היי! יש לך רעיון לאתר? ספר לי מה אתה רואה בראש ואני אבנה את זה. אתה מדבר, אני עובד. |
    78→
    79→### Build Done (Step 4 — First version ready)
    80→
    81→| Context | English | Hebrew |
    82→|---------|---------|--------|
    83→| Showing first build | Take a look — I put together a first version. | תסתכל — הרכבתי גרסה ראשונה. |
    84→
    85→### Error
    86→
    87→| Context | English | Hebrew |
    88→|---------|---------|--------|
    89→| Something broke | Whoops. Give me a sec... | אופס. שנייה... |
    90→| Bigger issue | Something tripped up. Let me try a different angle. | משהו השתבש. ננסה מכיוון אחר. |
    91→
    92→### Celebration (Step 9 — Site is live)
    93→
    94→| Context | English | Hebrew |
    95→|---------|---------|--------|
    96→| Site deployed | That's it. You have a website. On the actual internet. Anyone with the link can see it right now. Let that sink in. | זהו. יש לך אתר. באינטרנט. ברצינות. כל אחד עם הלינק יכול לראות את זה עכשיו. |
    97→
    98→### Feedback Request (Step 5 — Iterate)
    99→
   100→| Context | English | Hebrew |
   101→|---------|---------|--------|
   102→| Asking for feedback | So? What do you think? Tell me what bugs you, what you like, what's missing. | נו, מה אתה אומר? תגיד מה מפריע, מה בסדר, מה חסר. |
   103→
   104→### Shipping Offer (Step 7)
   105→
   106→| Context | English | Hebrew |
   107→|---------|---------|--------|
   108→| Offer to deploy | Want to put this on the internet? I can give you a link that works for anyone, anywhere. | רוצה לשים את זה באינטרנט? אני יכול לתת לך לינק שעובד לכל אחד, מכל מקום. |
   109→
   110→---
   111→
   112→## Planning / Onboarding Strings
   113→
   114→| Context | English | Hebrew |
   115→|---------|---------|--------|
   116→| Planning header | Let's figure out what you need | בוא נבין מה אתה צריך |
   117→| Ready to start | Hey! I'm ready to start | היי! אני מוכן להתחיל |
   118→| What to build | What do you feel like building? | מה בא לך לבנות? |
   119→

content.content:
1→---
     2→name: cc4d
     3→description: You want to build something but you're not technical. This skill walks you through the entire process — from first conversation to a live URL — step by step.
     4→metadata:
     5→  author: Michaelliv
     6→  version: "3.0"
     7→  series: cc-for-dummies
     8→---
     9→
    10→# Claude Code for Dummies
    11→
    12→You are guiding a non-technical person through building something with Claude Code. This is a structured, step-by-step process. You do not decide what step you're on — the progress script does.
    13→
    14→## How This Works
    15→
    16→1. Run `bash scripts/progress.sh next` to get your current step instructions
    17→2. Follow the ACTION in the step
    18→3. Verify the CHECK passes
    19→4. Save what you learned to CLAUDE.md (every step has a CAPTURE section)
    20→5. Run `bash scripts/progress.sh complete N` to advance to the next step
    21→6. Repeat
    22→
    23→**Never skip steps. Never guess what step you're on. Always ask the progress script.**
    24→
    25→## Rules
    26→
    27→- **Voice**: Talk like a warm, direct friend — not a textbook, not a chatbot. See `references/voice.md` for the full guide. Singular address always ("you"/"אתה/את", never "you guys"/"אתם").
    28→- Use plain language. No jargon. If you must use a technical term, explain it in parentheses.
    29→- Action first, explanation second. Do things, then tell them what you did.
    30→- Fix, don't instruct. When something is broken, fix it yourself.
    31→- Only pause for genuine user action: account signups, giving feedback, making decisions.
    32→- Permission key is **Enter** to approve, **Escape** to deny. Never say "press Y".
    33→- No time promises. Never say "30 seconds" or "in a minute". Never set timeouts on commands — if a command might take a while, use `run_in_background: true` instead.
    34→- Long-running commands (`npx create-next-app`, `npm install`, `npm run dev`, `npx vercel`) **must** use `run_in_background: true`. Never use `&` to background a command. Never set a timeout hoping it'll finish in time. Use `TaskOutput` to check on progress or wait for completion.
    35→- Pick sensible defaults. Never ask the user to choose between technical options.
    36→- After EVERY step, update CLAUDE.md with what the CAPTURE section specifies. This is critical — if the user leaves and comes back, CLAUDE.md is all you have.
    37→
    38→## Starting a Session
    39→
    40→**New user (no .cc4d-progress.json):**
    41→Run `bash scripts/progress.sh next` — it will initialize at Step 1.
    42→
    43→**Returning user (.cc4d-progress.json exists):**
    44→1. Read CLAUDE.md to remember who they are and what they built
    45→2. Run `bash scripts/progress.sh status` to see where they left off
    46→3. Greet them by name
    47→4. Run `bash scripts/progress.sh next` and continue from where they stopped
    48→
    49→## Progress Commands
    50→
    51→| Command | What it does |
    52→|---|---|
    53→| `bash scripts/progress.sh next` | Show current step instructions |
    54→| `bash scripts/progress.sh complete N` | Mark step N done, show next step |
    55→| `bash scripts/progress.sh status` | Show progress summary |
    56→| `bash scripts/progress.sh reset` | Start over from Step 1 |
    57→
    58→## The Steps
    59→
    60→9 steps across 4 phases. You don't need to know them all — `progress.sh next` gives you one at a time.
    61→
    62→| Phase | Steps | What happens |
    63→|---|---|---|
    64→| 0: Setup | 1-2 | Environment check, orientation |
    65→| 1: Build | 3-4 | Gather idea with AskUserQuestion, scaffold Next.js + agentation, build first version |
    66→| 2: Iterate | 5-6 | React & iterate (feedback loop with agentation), save progress |
    67→| 3: Shipping | 7-9 | Offer to ship, GitHub + Vercel deploy, celebrate |
    68→
    69→## Workspace Mode
    70→
    71→When the user's first message starts with `[WORKSPACE MODE]`, the project already has a first build and the user is returning to make changes. This is a **free-form, task-oriented** mode — NOT the step-by-step wizard.
    72→
    73→### What to do
    74→
    75→1. **Do NOT run `progress.sh`** — no `next`, no `complete`, no step system at all.
    76→2. **Read CLAUDE.md** to understand the project (name, vibe, audience, tech stack, what was built).
    77→3. **Check if the dev server is running** — run `npm run dev` with `run_in_background: true` if it's not already up on port 3000.
    78→4. **Wait for the user's actual message** — the `[WORKSPACE MODE]` message is system context, not a user request. The user's next message will describe what they need (add a feature, fix a bug, change the design, deploy, etc.).
    79→5. **Execute the task** using the same principles as the wizard: plain language, fix don't instruct, pick sensible defaults, action first explanation second.
    80→6. **Deploy when asked** — when the user says "deploy", "put it online", or similar: run `git add -A && git commit -m "Update site" && npx vercel --prod --yes` (use `run_in_background: true` for vercel). Report the live URL back.
    81→7. **Update CLAUDE.md** after significant changes to keep it current for next time.
    82→
    83→### What NOT to do
    84→
    85→- Do NOT send an introductory greeting or "what would you like to do?" message — the user drives.
    86→- Do NOT run `bash scripts/progress.sh` anything.
    87→- Do NOT follow the 9-step flow. The project is past the wizard.
    88→
    89→## References
    90→
    91→- `references/voice.md` — **SOUL**: the voice guide. Read this before writing any user-facing text.
    92→- `references/feedback-cheatsheet.md` — Agentation usage, feedback phrases, plan mode guide
    93→- `references/shipping-reference.md` — GitHub/Vercel commands, auto-deploy explanation
    94→
    95→## Begin
    96→
    97→Run `bash scripts/progress.sh next` now.
    98→

1→# Desktop App — Technical Architecture
     2→
     3→> Authoritative reference for the `desktop/` Electron app and its integration with the `skills/cc4d/` guided website-building skill.
     4→
     5→---
     6→
     7→## System Overview
     8→
     9→The desktop app is an **Electron + Next.js** hybrid that wraps a Claude Code CLI session inside a friendly UI for non-technical users. The CC4D skill provides a 9-step guided workflow that Claude follows to build and ship a website on the user's behalf.
    10→
    11→```
    12→+------------------------------------------------------------------+
    13→|                        ELECTRON SHELL                             |
    14→|  electron/main.js                                                |
    15→|                                                                  |
    16→|  +------------------+    +-------------------+                   |
    17→|  |  BrowserWindow   |    |  electron-store   |                   |
    18→|  |  (Chromium)      |    |  (cc4d-projects)  |                   |
    19→|  +--------+---------+    +-------------------+                   |
    20→|           |                       ^                              |
    21→|           | loads                  | IPC: project:*              |
    22→|           v                       |                              |
    23→|  +--------+---------------------------+---------+                |
    24→|  |              PRELOAD BRIDGE                   |               |
    25→|  |  contextBridge → window.electronAPI           |               |
    26→|  |  (locale, project CRUD, chat I/O, logging)    |               |
    27→|  +--+-------------------------------------------++               |
    28→+-----|---------------------------------------------|---------------+
    29→      |                                             |
    30→      v                                             v
    31→+-----|---------------------------------------------|---------------+
    32→|     |          NEXT.JS APP (port 3456)            |              |
    33→|     |                                             |              |
    34→|  +--+------------------------------------------+  |              |
    35→|  |           RENDERER (React + Zustand)         |  |              |
    36→|  |                                              |  |              |
    37→|  |  /setup → /welcome → /build → /ship → /done |  |              |
    38→|  |                                              |  |              |
    39→|  |  +------------------+  +------------------+  |  |              |
    40→|  |  | ChatPanel        |  | LivePreview      |  |  |              |
    41→|  |  | (user types msg) |  | (webview/iframe) |  |  |              |
    42→|  |  +--------+---------+  +--------+---------+  |  |              |
    43→|  |           |                     ^             |  |              |
    44→|  |           v                     |             |  |              |
    45→|  |  +--------+---------------------+----------+  |  |              |
    46→|  |  |         agent-client.ts                  |  |  |              |
    47→|  |  |  fetch POST → SSE stream → parse events  |  |  |              |
    48→|  |  +-------------------+----------------------+  |  |              |
    49→|  +---------------------------+-------------------+  |              |
    50→|                              |                      |              |
    51→|                    HTTP POST |                      |              |
    52→|                              v                      |              |
    53→|  +---------------------------+-------------------+  |              |
    54→|  |            /api/agent (route.ts)              |  |              |
    55→|  |                                               |  |              |
    56→|  |  1. Resolve claude binary path                |  |              |
    57→|  |  2. spawn("claude", [...args])                |  |              |
    58→|  |     stdio: ["ignore", "pipe", "pipe"]         |  |              |
    59→|  |  3. Stream stdout → SSE events                |  |              |
    60→|  |  4. Return session_id for --resume            |  |              |
    61→|  +-------------------+---------------------------+  |              |
    62→+----------------------|-------------------------------+-------------+
    63→                       |
    64→                       | child_process.spawn
    65→                       v
    66→+----------------------+-------------------------------+
    67→|                  CLAUDE CLI                           |
    68→|  claude --print --output-format stream-json          |
    69→|         --dangerously-skip-permissions               |
    70→|         --verbose [--resume <sessionId>]             |
    71→|                                                      |
    72→|  Reads: CLAUDE.md (project root)                     |
    73→|  Contains: rewritten SKILL.md + user preferences     |
    74→|                                                      |
    75→|  Executes CC4D workflow:                             |
    76→|  +------------------------------------------------+  |
    77→|  |  bash .cc4d/scripts/progress.sh next           |  |
    78→|  |       ↓                                        |  |
    79→|  |  .cc4d-progress.json ←→ progress.sh            |  |
    80→|  |  (current_step, completed[], phase)            |  |
    81→|  |       ↓                                        |  |
    82→|  |  Reads .cc4d/steps/NN-step-name.md             |  |
    83→|  |  Follows ACTION → verifies CHECK → CAPTURE     |  |
    84→|  |       ↓                                        |  |
    85→|  |  bash .cc4d/scripts/progress.sh complete N     |  |
    86→|  |       ↓                                        |  |
    87→|  |  Updates CLAUDE.md with accumulated context     |  |
    88→|  +------------------------------------------------+  |
    89→+------------------------------------------------------+
    90→                       |
    91→                       | creates/modifies files in
    92→                       v
    93→+------------------------------------------------------+
    94→|              PROJECT DIRECTORY                        |
    95→|  ~/Documents/Claude Projects/<project-name>/         |
    96→|                                                      |
    97→|  CLAUDE.md              ← session memory             |
    98→|  .cc4d-progress.json    ← state machine position     |
    99→|  .cc4d/                                              |
   100→|    ├── scripts/progress.sh                           |
   101→|    ├── steps/01..09-*.md                             |
   102→|    ├── references/*.md                               |
   103→|    └── chat-history.json  ← persisted messages       |
   104→|  app/                                                |
   105→|    ├── page.tsx           ← user's website           |
   106→|    └── layout.tsx                                    |
   107→|  package.json                                        |
   108→|  ...                                                 |
   109→+------------------------------------------------------+
   110→```
   111→
   112→---
   113→
   114→## Electron Main Process
   115→
   116→**File:** `electron/main.js`
   117→
   118→The main process handles window lifecycle, IPC, Claude binary discovery, skill file management, and the embedded Next.js server.
   119→
   120→### Window Lifecycle
   121→
   122→1. **Production:** `startNextServer()` spawns the Next.js standalone server on a random available port, then `createWindow(port)` loads it.
   123→2. **Dev mode:** Next.js runs externally on port 3456 via `concurrently`. Electron connects to it directly.
   124→3. Window config: 1280×860, `hiddenInset` title bar on macOS, `webviewTag: true` for LivePreview, `contextIsolation: true`.
   125→4. External link clicks are intercepted and opened in the default browser via `shell.openExternal()`.
   126→
   127→### IPC Channels
   128→
   129→All IPC is handled via `ipcMain.handle()` (invoke/return) or `ipcMain.on()` (fire-and-forget).
   130→
   131→| Channel | Direction | Purpose |
   132→|---|---|---|
   133→| `locale:get` | renderer → main | Get OS locale, mapped to `"he"` or `"en"` |
   134→| `runtime:status` | renderer → main | Check Node.js ≥18, Git, and Claude binary availability |
   135→| `project:create` | renderer → main | Create project directory, git init, copy skill files, write CLAUDE.md |
   136→| `project:list` | renderer → main | List all projects sorted by `lastOpenedAt` |
   137→| `project:switch` | renderer → main | Set active project, update timestamp |
   138→| `project:update` | renderer → main | Partial update of project metadata |
   139→| `project:get-active` | renderer → main | Get currently active project |
   140→| `project:finalize-preferences` | renderer → main | Re-write CLAUDE.md with full user preferences after welcome flow |
   141→| `project:open` | renderer → main | Open project directory in Finder/Explorer |
   142→| `chat:load` | renderer → main | Load `.cc4d/chat-history.json` from project dir |
   143→| `chat:save` | renderer → main | Atomic write (tmp + rename) of chat history |
   144→| `preview:poll-port` | renderer → main | TCP poll a port (30s timeout) to detect dev server |
   145→| `shell:open-external` | renderer → main | Open URL in default browser |
   146→| `log:get-path` | renderer → main | Get electron log file path |
   147→| `log:from-renderer` | renderer → main | Forward renderer console.error/warn to file (fire-and-forget) |
   148→
   149→### Claude Binary Discovery
   150→
   151→`findClaude()` searches these paths in order:
   152→1. `~/.local/bin/claude`
   153→2. `~/.claude/bin/claude`
   154→3. `/usr/local/bin/claude`
   155→4. `/opt/homebrew/bin/claude`
   156→
   157→Both `electron/main.js` and `src/app/api/agent/route.ts` have their own `findClaude()` — the main process uses it for `runtime:status`, the API route uses it for spawning.
   158→
   159→### Project Store
   160→
   161→**File:** `electron/project-store.mjs`
   162→
   163→Wraps `electron-store` with the store name `cc4d-projects`. Schema:
   164→
   165→```
   166→{
   167→  projects: Array<{
   168→    id, name, displayName, path, createdAt, lastOpenedAt,
   169→    sessionId, locale, vibe, audience, priority, designRef,
   170→    liveUrl, githubUrl
   171→  }>,
   172→  activeProjectId: string | null
   173→}
   174→```
   175→
   176→Persisted to disk automatically by `electron-store` (JSON in the Electron user data directory).
   177→
   178→Functions: `getProjects()`, `getProject(id)`, `addProject(meta)`, `updateProject(id, updates)`, `removeProject(id)`, `getActiveProject()`, `setActiveProjectId(id)`.
   179→
   180→---
   181→
   182→## Next.js Renderer
   183→
   184→**Config:** `next.config.ts` — `output: "standalone"` for Electron embedding, `next-intl` plugin for i18n, `allowedDevOrigins` for dev mode cross-origin.
   185→
   186→### Pages and Routing
   187→
   188→The app uses a linear page flow. Users progress forward; there is no free navigation.
   189→
   190→| Route | Page | Purpose |
   191→|---|---|---|
   192→| `/setup` | `src/app/setup/page.tsx` | Runtime checks (Node.js, Git, Claude). Auto-advances to `/welcome`. |
   193→| `/welcome` | `src/app/welcome/page.tsx` | Gather idea, vibe, audience, priority, design reference. Creates project via IPC. |
   194→| `/build` | `src/app/build/page.tsx` | Main chat + live preview. Runs the CC4D skill via Claude CLI. |
   195→| `/ship` | `src/app/ship/page.tsx` | Deploy to Vercel/GitHub. |
   196→| `/done` | `src/app/done/page.tsx` | Celebration screen with links to live site. |
   197→
   198→### State Management (Zustand)
   199→
   200→**File:** `src/lib/store.ts`
   201→
   202→Single global store (`useAppStore`) with `persist` middleware. Key slices:
   203→
   204→| Slice | Fields | Persisted |
   205→|---|---|---|
   206→| Session | `sessionId`, `projectDir`, `activeProjectId` | Yes |
   207→| i18n | `locale` | Yes |
   208→| Progress | `currentStep`, `phase`, `completedSteps` | Yes |
   209→| Chat | `messages`, `isStreaming`, `messagesLoaded`, `currentActivity` | No (messages use file persistence) |
   210→| Project | `projectName`, `liveUrl`, `githubUrl` | Partially |
   211→| User prefs | `userName`, `vibe`, `audience`, `priority`, `designRef`, `idea` | Partially |
   212→| Runtime | `runtimeReady`, `claudeAuthenticated` | No |
   213→| Preview | `previewUrl`, `previewMode` | No |
   214→| UI | `projectDrawerOpen`, `milestones` | No |
   215→
   216→localStorage key: `cc4d-desktop-store`. Only a subset of fields is persisted (via `partialize`).
   217→
   218→---
   219→
   220→## Agent Communication
   221→
   222→### SSE Route
   223→
   224→**File:** `src/app/api/agent/route.ts`
   225→
   226→`POST /api/agent` accepts:
   227→```json
   228→{ "prompt": "...", "locale": "he"|"en", "projectDir": "/path", "sessionId": "..." }
   229→```
   230→
   231→Behavior:
   232→1. Resolves Claude binary via `findClaude()`.
   233→2. Prepends Hebrew instruction if `locale === "he"`.
   234→3. Builds args: `--print --output-format stream-json --dangerously-skip-permissions --verbose [--resume <sessionId>]`.
   235→4. Spawns with `stdio: ["ignore", "pipe", "pipe"]` — **stdin must be `"ignore"`** or Claude hangs.
   236→5. Deletes `CLAUDECODE` env var from child to allow nesting inside a Claude Code session.
   237→6. Streams stdout as SSE (`data: {...}\n\n`), forwards stderr errors.
   238→7. Sends `data: [DONE]\n\n` on process close.
   239→8. Kills child on client disconnect (`req.signal` abort).
   240→
   241→### Agent Client
   242→
   243→**File:** `src/lib/agent-client.ts`
   244→
   245→`connectToAgent()` — client-side SSE consumer.
   246→
   247→1. POSTs to `/api/agent` with prompt, locale, projectDir, sessionId.
   248→2. Reads the response body as a stream.
   249→3. For each `data:` line, calls `parseAgentEvent()` to convert raw CLI JSON into `ChatMessage`.
   250→4. Captures `session_id` from result events for `--resume`.
   251→5. Returns `{ abort }` handle.
   252→
   253→### Event Parsing
   254→
   255→`parseAgentEvent(raw, locale, callbacks)` maps Claude CLI stream-json events to UI messages:
   256→
   257→| CLI Event | UI Result |
   258→|---|---|
   259→| `system`, `rate_limit_event`, `user` (tool_result) | Skipped |
   260→| `assistant` → text block | `ChatMessage` with `role: "assistant"` |
   261→| `assistant` → `Bash` tool_use | `role: "status"` with friendly label (e.g. "Setting up your project...") |
   262→| `assistant` → `Write`/`Edit` tool_use | `role: "status"` with filename (e.g. "Creating page.tsx...") |
   263→| `assistant` → `Glob`/`Grep`/`Read` tool_use | `null` (filtered out — not interesting to user) |
   264→| `assistant` → `AskUserQuestion` tool_use | `role: "assistant"` with `questionData` |
   265→| `result` (success) | `null` (content already streamed) |
   266→| `result` (error) or `error` | `role: "status"` error message |
   267→
   268→### Callbacks
   269→
   270→`AgentCallbacks` enable the build page to react to events:
   271→
   272→| Callback | Trigger | Action |
   273→|---|---|---|
   274→| `onDevServerDetected` | Bash command contains `npm run dev` or `next dev` | Poll port 3000, set `previewUrl` |
   275→| `onFileChanged` | Write/Edit tool with `file_path` | Increment `refreshTrigger` → webview reload |
   276→| `onStepCompleted` | Bash command matches `progress.sh complete N` | Update step/phase in store |
   277→| `onLiveUrl` | Text contains `https://...vercel.app` | Store live URL, persist to electron-store |
   278→
   279→---
   280→
   281→## CC4D Skill System
   282→
   283→**Root:** `skills/cc4d/`
   284→
   285→### State Machine
   286→
   287→The skill uses a file-based state machine driven by `progress.sh`:
   288→
   289→**State file:** `.cc4d-progress.json`
   290→```json
   291→{
   292→  "current_step": 4,
   293→  "completed": [1, 2, 3],
   294→  "phase": 1
   295→}
   296→```
   297→
   298→**Commands:**
   299→
   300→| Command | Effect |
   301→|---|---|
   302→| `bash .cc4d/scripts/progress.sh next` | Read state, cat the current step's markdown file |
   303→| `bash .cc4d/scripts/progress.sh complete N` | Append N to completed, advance `current_step` to N+1, recalculate phase |
   304→| `bash .cc4d/scripts/progress.sh status` | Print summary (current step, phase, completed list) |
   305→| `bash .cc4d/scripts/progress.sh reset` | Delete state file, reinitialize at step 1 |
   306→
   307→Phase calculation: steps 1-2 → phase 0, steps 3-4 → phase 1, steps 5-6 → phase 2, steps 7-9 → phase 3.
   308→
   309→### 9-Step Workflow
   310→
   311→```
   312→Phase 0: Setup          Phase 1: Build         Phase 2: Iterate       Phase 3: Ship
   313→+-----------------+    +------------------+    +------------------+   +------------------+
   314→| 1. Check Env    | →  | 3. Gather Idea   | →  | 5. React/Iterate | → | 7. Offer to Ship |
   315→| 2. Orient User  |    | 4. Scaffold+Build|    | 6. Save Progress |   | 8. Push+Deploy   |
   316→+-----------------+    +------------------+    +------------------+   | 9. Celebrate     |
   317→                                                      ↑       |      +------------------+
   318→                                                      +-------+
   319→                                                   (feedback loop)
   320→```
   321→
   322→| Step | File | Purpose |
   323→|---|---|---|
   324→| 1 | `01-check-environment.md` | Verify Node.js, Git, Claude CLI |
   325→| 2 | `02-orient-user.md` | Greet user, explain what's about to happen |
   326→| 3 | `03-gather-idea.md` | Use AskUserQuestion to collect idea, vibe, audience |
   327→| 4 | `04-scaffold-and-build.md` | `npx create-next-app`, build first version |
   328→| 5 | `05-react-and-iterate.md` | Show site, gather feedback, iterate |
   329→| 6 | `06-save-progress.md` | Git commit, update CLAUDE.md |
   330→| 7 | `07-offer-to-ship.md` | Ask if user wants to publish |
   331→| 8 | `08-push-and-deploy.md` | GitHub repo + Vercel deploy |
   332→| 9 | `09-celebrate.md` | Show live URL, celebrate |
   333→
   334→Each step file has three sections:
   335→- **ACTION** — what Claude should do
   336→- **CHECK** — verification condition
   337→- **CAPTURE** — what to save to CLAUDE.md
   338→
   339→### References
   340→
   341→- `references/feedback-cheatsheet.md` — Agentation patterns, feedback phrases, plan mode guide
   342→- `references/shipping-reference.md` — GitHub/Vercel CLI commands, auto-deploy explanation
   343→
   344→---
   345→
   346→## Desktop ↔ CC4D Integration
   347→
   348→The desktop app pre-completes steps 1-3 during its onboarding flow, so Claude starts at step 4 with all preferences already captured.
   349→
   350→### Project Creation Flow
   351→
   352→The welcome page uses a two-phase approach: create the project directory first (with empty idea), then finalize preferences after the user answers all questions.
   353→
   354→```
   355→User arrives at /welcome, answers preference questions
   356→       |
   357→       v
   358→User clicks "Start Building"
   359→       |
   360→       v
   361→electronAPI.createProject("", locale)         ← Phase 1: scaffold
   362→       |
   363→       v (IPC: project:create)
   364→electron/main.js:
   365→  1. slug = "new-project" (idea is empty)
   366→  2. deduplicatePath() → unique name
   367→  3. mkdir ~/Documents/Claude Projects/<name>/
   368→  4. git init (via dugite)
   369→  5. copySkillFiles(skills/cc4d → .cc4d/)
   370→  6. writeProjectClaudeMd(projectPath, null):
   371→     - Read SKILL.md, strip YAML frontmatter
   372→     - Rewrite paths: scripts/ → .cc4d/scripts/
   373→     - Write → CLAUDE.md (no preferences yet)
   374→  7. initProgressState():
   375→     - Write .cc4d-progress.json
   376→       {current_step: 4, completed: [1,2,3], phase: 1}
   377→  8. Store metadata in electron-store
   378→  9. Return ProjectMeta
   379→       |
   380→       v
   381→electronAPI.finalizePreferences(meta.id, {    ← Phase 2: preferences
   382→  idea, vibe, audience, priority, designRef
   383→})
   384→       |
   385→       v (IPC: project:finalize-preferences)
   386→electron/main.js:
   387→  1. Re-write CLAUDE.md with full preferences appended:
   388→     - Idea, Style/Vibe, Audience, Priority, Design reference
   389→     - "Steps 1-3 pre-completed by desktop app" note
   390→  2. Re-write .cc4d-progress.json (same state, step 4)
   391→  3. Persist preferences to electron-store
   392→       |
   393→       v
   394→store.setStep(4, 1) → router.push("/build")
   395→       |
   396→       v
   397→Auto-send initial prompt:
   398→  formatInitialMessage({idea, vibe, audience, priority, designRef, locale})
   399→       |
   400→       v
   401→Claude reads CLAUDE.md, runs progress.sh next, begins Step 4
   402→```
   403→
   404→### CLAUDE.md Rewriting
   405→
   406→`writeProjectClaudeMd()` transforms the skill's `SKILL.md` into a project-local `CLAUDE.md`:
   407→
   408→1. Strips YAML frontmatter (`---...---`).
   409→2. Rewrites relative paths: `scripts/` → `.cc4d/scripts/`, `references/` → `.cc4d/references/`, `steps/` → `.cc4d/steps/`.
   410→3. Appends a "Desktop App Note" section explaining steps 1-3 are pre-completed.
   411→4. Appends a "What we know" section with user preferences.
   412→
   413→### Progress Sync
   414→
   415→The build page watches for progress events via `AgentCallbacks.onStepCompleted`:
   416→
   417→1. `parseAgentEvent()` regex-matches `progress.sh complete N` in Bash tool_use commands.
   418→2. Fires `onStepCompleted(N)`.
   419→3. Build page calls `store.completeStep(N)` and `store.setStep(N+1, phase)`.
   420→4. The `StepIndicator` component reflects the updated progress.
   421→
   422→---
   423→
   424→## Message Lifecycle
   425→
   426→```
   427→User types message
   428→       |
   429→       v
   430→ChatPanel → handleSend(message)
   431→       |
   432→       v
   433→store.addMessage({role:"user", content, timestamp})
   434→       |
   435→       v
   436→connectToAgent({prompt, locale, projectDir, sessionId})
   437→       |
   438→       v
   439→fetch POST /api/agent ──────────────────────► route.ts
   440→                                                  |
   441→                                          spawn claude CLI
   442→                                                  |
   443→◄──────────── SSE stream ─────────────────────────┘
   444→  data: {"type":"assistant","message":{content:[{text}]}}
   445→  data: {"type":"assistant","message":{content:[{tool_use}]}}
   446→  data: {"type":"result","session_id":"..."}
   447→  data: [DONE]
   448→       |
   449→       v
   450→parseAgentEvent(raw, locale, callbacks)
   451→  ├─ assistant text  → {role:"assistant", content}
   452→  ├─ Bash tool_use   → {role:"status", content:"friendly label"}
   453→  ├─ Write tool_use  → {role:"status", content:"Creating file..."}
   454→  ├─ Edit tool_use   → {role:"status", content:"Editing file..."}
   455→  ├─ AskUserQuestion → {role:"assistant", questionData}
   456→  ├─ Glob/Grep/Read  → null (filtered, not shown)
   457→  └─ result          → captures session_id, returns null
   458→       |
   459→       v
   460→store.addMessage(parsed)
   461→       |
   462→       v
   463→buildActivityBlocks(messages) → ActivityBlock[]
   464→  ├─ "user-input" blocks
   465→  ├─ "assistant" blocks (markdown rendered)
   466→  ├─ "building" blocks (collapsible, file list)
   467→  ├─ "question" blocks (QuestionCard UI)
   468→  └─ "error" blocks
   469→       |
   470→       v
   471→ChatHistory renders blocks
   472→       |
   473→       v (debounced 500ms)
   474→electronAPI.saveChatHistory() → IPC → .cc4d/chat-history.json
   475→```
   476→
   477→### Activity Blocks
   478→
   479→**File:** `src/lib/activity-blocks.ts`
   480→
   481→Messages are grouped into `ActivityBlock[]` for display. Consecutive messages of the same type merge:
   482→
   483→| Block Type | Merge Rule | Contains |
   484→|---|---|---|
   485→| `user-input` | One per user message | User's text |
   486→| `assistant` | Consecutive assistant texts merge | Markdown content |
   487→| `building` | Consecutive status messages merge | File list, tool commands |
   488→| `question` | One per AskUserQuestion | Question cards with options |
   489→| `error` | One per error | Error status message |
   490→
   491→Two modes: `buildActivityBlocks()` for full rebuild (on load), `appendToBlocks()` for incremental append (during streaming).
   492→
   493→### Chat Persistence
   494→
   495→**File:** `src/lib/use-chat-persistence.ts`
   496→
   497→- **Load:** On mount or project change, reads `.cc4d/chat-history.json` via IPC (`chat:load`).
   498→- **Save:** Debounced 500ms after any `messages` change, writes via IPC (`chat:save`). Uses atomic write (tmp file + rename).
   499→- Falls back gracefully in dev mode without Electron.
   500→
   501→---
   502→
   503→## Logging Architecture
   504→
   505→Four log categories, all written to `~/.claude-for-beginners/logs/`:
   506→
   507→| File | Source | Writer | Contents |
   508→|---|---|---|---|
   509→| `electron.log` | Main process | `electron-log` | App lifecycle, IPC, window events, Next.js server |
   510→| `agent.log` | API route | `src/lib/logger.ts` (`agentLog`) | Claude CLI spawn, SSE events, session lifecycle |
   511→| `agent-debug.log` | API route | `src/lib/logger.ts` (`debugLog`) | Raw CLI JSON payloads |
   512→| `app.log` | Next.js server | `src/lib/logger.ts` (`appLog`) | General app-level logs |
   513→| `renderer.log` | Browser | IPC `log:from-renderer` | `console.error`, `console.warn`, uncaught exceptions |
   514→
   515→### Rotation
   516→
   517→- **electron.log:** `electron-log` auto-rotates, keeps `electron.log` + `electron.old.log`. 5 MB max.
   518→- **Server-side logs (agent, app):** `logger.ts` rotates at 5 MB, keeps up to 5 numbered files (`.1` through `.5`).
   519→- **renderer.log:** Main process handles rotation at 5 MB, keeps one `.old` backup.
   520→
   521→### Renderer Logger
   522→
   523→**File:** `src/lib/renderer-logger.ts`
   524→
   525→Patches `console.error` and `console.warn` in the browser to forward messages to the main process via IPC. Also captures `window.error` and `unhandledrejection` events. Imported once in the root layout.
   526→
   527→### Server-Side Logger
   528→
   529→**File:** `src/lib/logger.ts`
   530→
   531→Category-based file logger. `createLogger(category)` returns `{ debug, info, warn, error }`. Each call appends a timestamped line to `~/.claude-for-beginners/logs/<category>.log`. Auto-cleans log files older than 7 days on module load.
   532→
   533→---
   534→
   535→## Build & Packaging
   536→
   537→**Config:** `electron-builder.yml`
   538→
   539→| Field | Value |
   540→|---|---|
   541→| `appId` | `dev.the-shift.claude-for-beginners` |
   542→| `productName` | Claude for Beginners |
   543→| `output` | `build/` |
   544→| `files` | `electron/**/*`, `.next/standalone/**/*`, `.next/static/**/*`, `public/**/*`, `messages/**/*` |
   545→| `extraResources` | Bundled Node.js, Git, and `skills/cc4d` → `cc4d-skill` |
   546→
   547→### Platform Targets
   548→
   549→| Platform | Format | Arch |
   550→|---|---|---|
   551→| macOS | DMG | arm64, x64 |
   552→| Windows | NSIS installer | x64 |
   553→| Linux | AppImage | — |
   554→
   555→### Production Packaging
   556→
   557→In production, the skill files are bundled as an extra resource at `process.resourcesPath/cc4d-skill`. `getSkillSourceDir()` switches between the dev path (`../../skills/cc4d`) and the packaged path based on `app.isPackaged`.
   558→
   559→The Next.js app is pre-built with `output: "standalone"`, producing a self-contained `server.js` that the main process spawns on a random port at startup.
   560→
   561→### Publishing
   562→
   563→GitHub Releases via `electron-builder`'s `publish.provider: github`.
   564→
   565→---
   566→
   567→## Key Files Index
   568→
   569→| Area | File | Purpose |
   570→|---|---|---|
   571→| Electron main | `electron/main.js` | Window lifecycle, IPC handlers, project creation |
   572→| Preload bridge | `electron/preload.js` | `window.electronAPI` surface |
   573→| Project store | `electron/project-store.mjs` | `electron-store` wrapper for project metadata |
   574→| Project utils | `electron/project-utils.js` | `slugifyIdea()`, `deduplicatePath()` |
   575→| Agent route | `src/app/api/agent/route.ts` | SSE endpoint, Claude CLI spawning |
   576→| Agent client | `src/lib/agent-client.ts` | Client-side SSE consumer, event parsing |
   577→| App store | `src/lib/store.ts` | Zustand global state |
   578→| Chat persistence | `src/lib/use-chat-persistence.ts` | Load/save chat via IPC |
   579→| Activity blocks | `src/lib/activity-blocks.ts` | Message → visual block grouping |
   580→| Server logger | `src/lib/logger.ts` | File-based category logger |
   581→| Renderer logger | `src/lib/renderer-logger.ts` | Patches console.error/warn → IPC |
   582→| Debug store | `src/lib/debug-store.ts` | Raw event store for debug terminal |
   583→| Setup page | `src/app/setup/page.tsx` | Runtime checks |
   584→| Welcome page | `src/app/welcome/page.tsx` | Onboarding, preference collection |
   585→| Build page | `src/app/build/page.tsx` | Chat + preview, agent orchestration |
   586→| Ship page | `src/app/ship/page.tsx` | Deployment flow |
   587→| Done page | `src/app/done/page.tsx` | Celebration |
   588→| Live preview | `src/components/preview/LivePreview.tsx` | Webview/iframe for localhost preview |
   589→| Skill master | `skills/cc4d/SKILL.md` | CC4D skill instructions (becomes CLAUDE.md) |
   590→| Progress script | `skills/cc4d/scripts/progress.sh` | State machine driver |
   591→| Step files | `skills/cc4d/steps/01-09-*.md` | Individual step instructions |
   592→| Next config | `next.config.ts` | Standalone output, i18n, dev origins |
   593→| Builder config | `electron-builder.yml` | Packaging targets and resources |
   594→

content.text:
Here are the findings for all four areas:

---

## 1. "Soul" / "Voice" References

There is a dedicated file at:

`/Users/tombensim/code/the-shift/claude-for-dummies/skills/cc4d/references/voice.md`

It is titled **"Voice Guide — SOUL"** and is the product's voice/tone guide. Key facts:
- Describes the voice as "warm, direct, a little self-deprecating, never preachy"
- Inspired by Shaul Amsterdamsky's writing style — "like someone talking to you across a cafe table in Jerusalem"
- Contains 9 voice principles (write like you talk, action first, honest deflation, etc.)
- Has Do/Don't sections, Hebrew-specific and English-specific guidance, and a phrase example table covering all 9 skill steps
- Referenced throughout SKILL.md as `references/voice.md` — it's described as **"SOUL: the voice guide. Read this before writing any user-facing text."**

No other matches for "soul-voice" or "soul" as a compound term were found — this file is the sole "soul" reference and it's intentionally titled that way.

---

## 2. CC4D Skill — Planning vs Execution Flow

The skill lives in `/Users/tombensim/code/the-shift/claude-for-dummies/skills/cc4d/` and uses a **9-step, 4-phase file-based state machine** driven by `scripts/progress.sh` and `.cc4d-progress.json`.

**Phases and steps:**

| Phase | Steps | What happens |
|---|---|---|
| 0: Setup | 1-2 | `01-check-environment.md`, `02-orient-user.md` |
| 1: Build | 3-4 | `03-gather-idea.md` (AskUserQuestion), `04-scaffold-and-build.md` (npx create-next-app + first version) |
| 2: Iterate | 5-6 | `05-react-and-iterate.md` (feedback loop), `06-save-progress.md` (git commit) |
| 3: Ship | 7-9 | `07-offer-to-ship.md`, `08-push-and-deploy.md`, `09-celebrate.md` |

Each step file has three sections: **ACTION** (what Claude does), **CHECK** (verification condition), **CAPTURE** (what to write to CLAUDE.md). Steps 5-6 loop: after iterating, Claude can repeat the feedback loop before moving to shipping.

The **desktop app pre-completes steps 1-3** during its own onboarding UI, writing `.cc4d-progress.json` with `{current_step: 4, completed: [1,2,3], phase: 1}` so Claude starts directly at step 4 (scaffold and build).

**Workspace Mode** is a separate non-step-based mode triggered by `[WORKSPACE MODE]` prefix — it bypasses `progress.sh` entirely for returning users who already have a first build.

---

## 3. Models Referenced in the Desktop App

**No specific model names (opus, sonnet, haiku, claude-3, claude-4) appear anywhere in the desktop app source code.**

The API route at `/Users/tombensim/code/the-shift/claude-for-dummies/desktop/src/app/api/agent/route.ts` spawns the Claude CLI binary directly without specifying a `--model` flag:

```
claude --print --output-format stream-json --dangerously-skip-permissions --verbose [--resume <sessionId>]
```

The model is whatever the Claude CLI defaults to or has been configured to use externally. No model is hardcoded in the agent route, agent-client, or any config file.

---

## 4. Linear CLI / Linear-Related Files

There are **no Linear CLI config files or Linear-related files** in the repository. The only grep hit for "linear" in `desktop/ARCHITECTURE.md` was:

> "The app uses a linear page flow. Users progress forward; there is no free navigation."

That's describing the UI navigation pattern, not the Linear project management tool. All other "linear" matches were inside `node_modules` (CSS easing utilities from the `motion-dom` package). No `.linear` config, no Linear SDK, no Linear API references anywhere in the repo.

# Voice Guide — "SOUL"

This is the voice of the product. Every user-facing string — greeting, error, celebration, feedback request — should sound like it came from the same person: warm, direct, a little self-deprecating, never preachy.

Inspired by Shaul Amsterdamsky's writing style: like someone talking to you across a cafe table in Jerusalem. Not a textbook. Not a startup pitch deck. A person.

---

## 9 Voice Principles

1. **Write like you talk.** Spoken register. Fragments OK. Trail-offs OK. If you wouldn't say it out loud to a friend, rewrite it.
2. **Action first, poetry second.** Do the thing, then comment on it. Never explain what you're about to explain.
3. **Honest deflation.** Build a moment up, then ground it. "Your site is live. On the actual internet. I know, I'm surprised too."
4. **Self-deprecating, never user-deprecating.** You're the butt of the joke. The user is never dumb, slow, or wrong.
5. **Singular address.** "You" not "you guys". "אתה/את" not "אתם". This is a 1:1 conversation.
6. **Concrete over abstract.** Name the thing. "I changed the button color" not "I made some visual adjustments."
7. **Short sentences.** If a sentence has a comma, consider splitting it. If it has two commas, definitely split it.
8. **Framing is everything.** An error is not a failure — it's "whoops, give me a sec." Shipping is not a technical process — it's "putting this on the internet so anyone can see it."
9. **No jargon, no filler.** No "leverage", "utilize", "in order to", "it's important to note that". Say it plain.

---

## Do's and Don'ts

### Do

- Use "Hey" not "Hello" or "Welcome"
- Admit when something broke: "Whoops" / "אופס"
- Celebrate simply: "That's it. You have a website." not "Congratulations on your achievement!"
- Ask for feedback directly: "What do you think?" not "Please provide your feedback"

# Claude for Beginners — Desktop App v0.1.0

**Release Date:** 2026-02-18
**Status:** Internal Alpha
**Platform:** macOS (Electron + Next.js 16)

---

## Overview

First release of the Claude for Beginners desktop application. A guided, beginner-friendly Electron app that wraps Claude Code CLI to help non-technical users build websites through conversation. Supports Hebrew (RTL, default) and English.

---

## Features

### 1. Project Management

- **Automatic project creation** — creates a directory under `~/Documents/Claude Projects/<slug>/` with `git init`
- **Smart slug generation** — strips EN/HE stop words, takes first 3 meaningful words, deduplicates with `-2`, `-3` suffix
- **Persistent metadata** — project state (name, locale, vibe, sessionId, liveUrl) stored via `electron-store`
- **Project switcher** — welcome screen shows recent projects sorted by last opened, click to resume
- **Session resumption** — reopening a project restores the Claude session ID for continuity

### 2. Chat Interface

- **Activity block grouping** — consecutive tool calls merged into collapsible "building" blocks showing file count
- **Markdown rendering** — assistant messages rendered with `react-markdown` + `remark-gfm` (code blocks, links, lists)
- **Live activity bar** — animated status indicator during streaming (e.g., "Creating index.tsx...", "Installing packages...")
- **Chat persistence** — messages saved to `.cc4d/chat-history.json`, restored on app reopen
- **Conversation recovery banner** — auto-dismissing notification when a previous session is restored
- **Component architecture** — ChatPanel decomposed into UserMessage, AssistantMessage, BuildingBlock, ErrorMessage, ChatInput, ChatHistory, LiveActivityBar, ConversationRecoveryBanner

### 3. Agent Communication

- **SSE streaming** — real-time event parsing from Claude CLI via `/api/agent` route
- **Tool-aware status messages** — Bash, Write, Edit, git, shadcn commands produce friendly progress text
- **Session ID capture** — `onSessionId` callback persists session across restarts
- **Raw event forwarding** — `onRawEvent` callback feeds debug terminal
- **Locale-aware messages** — status text adapts to Hebrew/English

### 4. Guided Build Flow (cc4d Skill)

- **Skill bundling** — `skills/cc4d/` copied into project `.cc4d/` on creation
- **Progress tracking** — `.cc4d-progress.json` tracks completed steps
- **CLAUDE.md generation** — skill instructions written to project root, paths rewritten for local execution
- **Step indicator** — visual progress bar in build page header

### 5. Logging Infrastructure

- **4-file logging system** — electron.log, agent.log, app.log, renderer.log under `~/.claude-for-beginners/logs/`
- **Renderer log forwarding** — `console.error` and `console.warn` patched to forward to main process via IPC
- **Log rotation** — 5 MB max, 5 files rotation; electron.log uses `.old` backup
- **Dev convenience** — `npm run logs` tails all logs, `npm run debug:status` shows file sizes

### 6. Debug Tools

- **Debug terminal** — `Cmd+Shift+D` toggles overlay showing raw Claude CLI events
- **Color-coded events** — each event type (system, assistant, tool_use, result, error) has distinct color
- **Expandable rows** — click to see full JSON payload
- **Filtering** — text filter across all event fields
- **Auto-scroll** — follows latest events with manual override

### 7. Welcome Experience

- **Single-screen start** — simplified from multi-step onboarding to one-click "Start building!" button
- **Recent projects** — horizontal scrollable cards with relative timestamps ("just now", "yesterday", "3 days ago")
- **Bilingual UI** — full Hebrew RTL and English support with `next-intl`

### 8. Electron Shell

- **Window management** — 1200x800 default, 900x600 minimum, draggable title bar region
- **External links** — `shell:open-external` IPC handler for safe link opening
- **Bundled dependencies** — Node.js, Git (dugite), and cc4d skill packaged as extraResources
- **Auto DevTools** — developer tools open automatically in non-packaged builds

---

## Architecture

```
desktop/
├── electron/
│   ├── main.js              # Electron main process (IPC, window, project mgmt)
│   ├── preload.js           # Context bridge (window.electronAPI)
│   ├── preload.ts           # Type declarations for electronAPI
│   ├── project-store.js     # electron-store wrapper for project metadata
│   └── project-utils.js     # slugifyIdea, deduplicatePath helpers
├── src/
│   ├── app/
│   │   ├── api/agent/route.ts   # Next.js API route → Claude CLI spawn
│   │   ├── welcome/page.tsx     # Project selection / creation
│   │   ├── build/page.tsx       # Main chat + build interface
│   │   └── ship/page.tsx        # Deployment flow
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── chat/                # 9 chat sub-components
│   │   ├── debug/               # Debug terminal overlay
│   │   ├── brand/               # Logo, LanguageToggle
│   │   └── progress/            # StepIndicator, PhaseLabel
│   └── lib/
│       ├── store.ts             # Zustand state (messages, project, streaming)
│       ├── agent-client.ts      # SSE client + event parser
│       ├── activity-blocks.ts   # Message → activity block grouping
│       ├── use-chat-persistence.ts  # Load/save hook
│       ├── renderer-logger.ts   # Console patching for log forwarding
│       ├── debug-store.ts       # Debug terminal state
│       └── use-debug-shortcut.ts    # Cmd+Shift+D handler
├── messages/
│   ├── en.json                  # English translations
│   └── he.json                  # Hebrew translations
└── __tests__/                   # Unit, component, and E2E tests
```

---

## Dependencies Added (since initial commit)

| Package | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `react-markdown` | Markdown rendering in assistant messages |
| `remark-gfm` | GitHub-flavored markdown (tables, strikethrough) |
| `vitest` | Unit + component test runner |
| `@vitest/coverage-v8` | Code coverage |
| `@testing-library/react` | Component testing utilities |
| `@testing-library/jest-dom` | DOM assertion matchers |
| `@testing-library/user-event` | User interaction simulation |
| `@playwright/test` | E2E browser testing |
| `jsdom` | DOM environment for tests |

---

## Known Limitations (v0.1.0)

1. **macOS only** — no Windows/Linux testing or packaging yet
2. **No live preview** — browser preview panel removed in favor of single-column chat
3. **No deployment integration** — ship page exists but deployment flow not wired to a provider
4. **No auto-update** — no electron-updater configured
5. **No code signing** — macOS builds will trigger Gatekeeper warnings
6. **Claude CLI required** — expects `~/.local/bin/claude` to be installed separately
7. **Port conflict** — Next.js dev server on 3456 may conflict if not cleaned up on exit
8. **No offline mode** — requires internet for Claude CLI communication

---

## Build & Run

```bash
cd desktop
npm install
npm run dev          # Dev mode (Next.js + Electron)
npm run package      # Production build (macOS)
```

---

## What's Next (v0.2.0 candidates)

- Live browser preview (split pane or floating window)
- Vercel/Netlify deployment integration
- Auto-update via electron-updater
- Windows + Linux support
- Project rename / delete from UI
- Import existing project directory
- Onboarding tutorial / tooltips
