content.text:
Base directory for this skill: /Users/tombensim/.claude/skills/linear-cli

# Linear CLI

A CLI to manage Linear issues from the command line, with git and jj integration.

Generated from linear CLI v1.10.0

## Prerequisites

The `linear` command must be available on PATH. To check:

```bash
linear --version
```

If not installed, follow the instructions at:\
https://github.com/schpet/linear-cli?tab=readme-ov-file#install

## Best Practices for Markdown Content

When working with issue descriptions or comment bodies that contain markdown, **always prefer using file-based flags** instead of passing content as command-line arguments:

- Use `--description-file` for `issue create` and `issue update` commands
- Use `--body-file` for `comment add` and `comment update` commands

**Why use file-based flags:**

- Ensures proper formatting in the Linear web UI
- Avoids shell escaping issues with newlines and special characters
- Prevents literal `\n` sequences from appearing in markdown
- Makes it easier to work with multi-line content

**Example workflow:**

```bash
# Write markdown to a temporary file
cat > /tmp/description.md <<'EOF'
## Summary

- First item
- Second item

## Details

This is a detailed description with proper formatting.
EOF

# Create issue using the file
linear issue create --title "My Issue" --description-file /tmp/description.md

# Or for comments
linear issue comment add ENG-123 --body-file /tmp/comment.md
```

**Only use inline flags** (`--description`, `--body`) for simple, single-line content.

## Available Commands

```
linear auth               # Manage Linear authentication
linear issue              # Manage Linear issues
linear team               # Manage Linear teams
linear project            # Manage Linear projects
linear project-update     # Manage project status updates
linear milestone          # Manage Linear project milestones
linear initiative         # Manage Linear initiatives
linear initiative-update  # Manage initiative status updates (timeline posts)
linear label              # Manage Linear issue labels
linear document           # Manage Linear documents
linear config             # Interactively generate .linear.toml configuration
linear schema             # Print the GraphQL schema to stdout
linear api                # Make a raw GraphQL API request
```

## Reference Documentation

- [auth](references/auth.md) - Manage Linear authentication
- [issue](references/issue.md) - Manage Linear issues
- [team](references/team.md) - Manage Linear teams
- [project](references/project.md) - Manage Linear projects
- [project-update](references/project-update.md) - Manage project status updates
- [milestone](references/milestone.md) - Manage Linear project milestones
- [initiative](references/initiative.md) - Manage Linear initiatives
- [initiative-update](references/initiative-update.md) - Manage initiative status updates (timeline posts)
- [label](references/label.md) - Manage Linear issue labels
- [document](references/document.md) - Manage Linear documents
- [config](references/config.md) - Interactively generate .linear.toml configuration
- [schema](references/schema.md) - Print the GraphQL schema to stdout
- [api](references/api.md) - Make a raw GraphQL API request

For curated examples of organization features (initiatives, labels, projects, bulk operations), see [organization-features](references/organization-features.md).

## Discovering Options

To see available subcommands and flags, run `--help` on any command:

```bash
linear --help
linear issue --help
linear issue list --help
linear issue create --help
```

Each command has detailed help output describing all available flags and options.

## Using the Linear GraphQL API Directly

**Prefer the CLI for all supported operations.** The `api` command should only be used as a fallback for queries not covered by the CLI.

### Check the schema for available types and fields

Write the schema to a tempfile, then search it:

```bash
linear schema -o "${TMPDIR:-/tmp}/linear-schema.graphql"
grep -i "cycle" "${TMPDIR:-/tmp}/linear-schema.graphql"
grep -A 30 "^type Issue " "${TMPDIR:-/tmp}/linear-schema.graphql"
```

### Make a GraphQL request

**Important:** GraphQL queries containing non-null type markers (e.g. `String` followed by an exclamation mark) must be passed via heredoc stdin to avoid escaping issues. Simple queries without those markers can be passed inline.

```bash
# Simple query (no type markers, so inline is fine)
linear api '{ viewer { id name email } }'

# Query with variables — use heredoc to avoid escaping issues
linear api --variable teamId=abc123 <<'GRAPHQL'
query($teamId: String!) { team(id: $teamId) { name } }
GRAPHQL

# Search issues by text
linear api --variable term=onboarding <<'GRAPHQL'
query($term: String!) { searchIssues(term: $term, first: 20) { nodes { identifier title state { name } } } }
GRAPHQL

# Numeric and boolean variables
linear api --variable first=5 <<'GRAPHQL'
query($first: Int!) { issues(first: $first) { nodes { title } } }
GRAPHQL

# Complex variables via JSON
linear api --variables-json '{"filter": {"state": {"name": {"eq": "In Progress"}}}}' <<'GRAPHQL'
query($filter: IssueFilter!) { issues(filter: $filter) { nodes { title } } }
GRAPHQL

# Pipe to jq for filtering
linear api '{ issues(first: 5) { nodes { identifier title } } }' | jq '.data.issues.nodes[].title'
```

### Advanced: Using curl directly

For cases where you need full HTTP control, use `linear auth token`:

```bash
curl -s -X POST https://api.linear.app/graphql \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: $(linear auth token)" \
  -d '{"query": "{ viewer { id } }"}'
```

- **תהליך Execution opinionated** — Step 4 (scaffold-and-build) מריץ `npx create-next-app` עם Tailwind + shadcn ובונה גרסה ראשונה לפי ה-vibe שנבחר, ללא בחירת stack ע"י המשתמש
- **Agentation וסיבוב פידבק** — Steps 5–6 (react-and-iterate + save-progress): לולאת פידבק שבה המשתמש נותן הערות וקלוד מתקן, כולל git commit אוטומטי

input.new_string:
## v0.1.0 Summary

- **Manual installation** — No auto-update, no code signing. Users install manually from a .app file
- **macOS only** — No Windows/Linux support in this version
- **Opus only** — Claude CLI runs with the default model (Opus), no model selection in the UI
- **Planning flow works** — The first part of cc4d (steps 1–3): orient, gather idea, define vibe — fully functional through the desktop app which completes these steps and hands off to step 4
- **Opinionated execution** — Step 4 (scaffold-and-build) runs `npx create-next-app` with Tailwind + shadcn and builds a first version based on the selected vibe, no stack choice by the user
- **Agentation & feedback loop** — Steps 5–6 (react-and-iterate + save-progress): a feedback loop where the user gives notes and Claude iterates, including automatic git commits
- **Soul Voice (by Shaul)** — `references/voice.md` — The product's tone guide, inspired by Shaul Amsterdamsky's writing style. "Warm, direct, a little self-deprecating, never preachy." All user-facing text follows the voice guide

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Claude for Beginners — Desktop App v0.1.0

**Release Date:** 2026-02-18
**Status:** Internal Alpha
**Platform:** macOS (Electron + Next.js 16)

---

## Overview

First release of the Claude for Beginners desktop application. A guided, beginner-friendly Electron app that wraps Claude Code CLI to help non-technical users build websites through conversation. Supports Hebrew (RTL, default) and English.

---

## סיכום 0.1.0

- **התקנה ידנית** — אין auto-update, אין code signing. משתמשים מתקינים ידנית מקובץ .app
- **תמיכה רק macOS** — אין Windows/Linux בגרסה הזו
- **תמיכה רק ב-Opus** — Claude CLI רץ עם model ברירת מחדל (Opus), אין בחירת model בממשק
- **תהליך Planning עובד** — החלק הראשון של cc4d (steps 1–3): orient, gather idea, define vibe — עובד מלא דרך ה-desktop app שמשלים את השלבים האלו ומעביר ל-step 4
- **תהליך Execution opinionated** — Step 4 (scaffold-and-build) מריץ `npx create-next-app` עם Tailwind + shadcn ובונה גרסה ראשונה לפי ה-vibe שנבחר, ללא בחירת stack ע"י המשתמש
- **Agentation וסיבוב פידבק** — Steps 5–6 (react-and-iterate + save-progress): לולאת פידבק שבה המשתמש נותן הערות וקלוד מתקן, כולל git commit אוטומטי
- **Soul Voice (by Shaul)** — `references/voice.md` — מדריך הטון של המוצר, בהשראת שאול אמסטרדמסקי. "חם, ישיר, קצת צינוקי, אף פעם לא מטיף." כל הטקסטים user-facing עוברים דרך ה-voice guide

---

## Features

### 1. Project Management

- **Automatic project creation** — creates a directory under `~/Documents/Claude Projects/<slug>/` with `git init`
- **Smart slug generation** — strips EN/HE stop words, takes first 3 meaningful words, deduplicates with `-2`, `-3` suffix
- **Persistent metadata** — project state (name, locale, vibe, sessionId, liveUrl) stored via `electron-store`
- **Project switcher** — welcome screen shows recent projects sorted by last opened, click to resume
- **Session resumption** — reopening a project restores the Claude session ID for continuity

### 2. Chat Interface

- **Activity block grouping** — consecutive tool calls merged into collapsible "building" blocks showing file count
- **Markdown rendering** — assistant messages rendered with `react-markdown` + `remark-gfm` (code blocks, links, lists)
- **Live activity bar** — animated status indicator during streaming (e.g., "Creating index.tsx...", "Installing packages...")
- **Chat persistence** — messages saved to `.cc4d/chat-history.json`, restored on app reopen
- **Conversation recovery banner** — auto-dismissing notification when a previous session is restored
- **Component architecture** — ChatPanel decomposed into UserMessage, AssistantMessage, BuildingBlock, ErrorMessage, ChatInput, ChatHistory, LiveActivityBar, ConversationRecoveryBanner

### 3. Agent Communication

- **SSE streaming** — real-time event parsing from Claude CLI via `/api/agent` route
- **Tool-aware status messages** — Bash, Write, Edit, git, shadcn commands produce friendly progress text
- **Session ID capture** — `onSessionId` callback persists session across restarts
- **Raw event forwarding** — `onRawEvent` callback feeds debug terminal
- **Locale-aware messages** — status text adapts to Hebrew/English

### 4. Guided Build Flow (cc4d Skill)

- **Skill bundling** — `skills/cc4d/` copied into project `.cc4d/` on creation
- **Progress tracking** — `.cc4d-progress.json` tracks completed steps
- **CLAUDE.md generation** — skill instructions written to project root, paths rewritten for local execution
- **Step indicator** — visual progress bar in build page header

### 5. Logging Infrastructure

- **4-file logging system** — electron.log, agent.log, app.log, renderer.log under `~/.claude-for-beginners/logs/`
- **Renderer log forwarding** — `console.error` and `console.warn` patched to forward to main process via IPC
- **Log rotation** — 5 MB max, 5 files rotation; electron.log uses `.old` backup
- **Dev convenience** — `npm run logs` tails all logs, `npm run debug:status` shows file sizes

### 6. Debug Tools

- **Debug terminal** — `Cmd+Shift+D` toggles overlay showing raw Claude CLI events
- **Color-coded events** — each event type (system, assistant, tool_use, result, error) has distinct color
- **Expandable rows** — click to see full JSON payload
- **Filtering** — text filter across all event fields
- **Auto-scroll** — follows latest events with manual override

### 7. Welcome Experience

- **Single-screen start** — simplified from multi-step onboarding to one-click "Start building!" button
- **Recent projects** — horizontal scrollable cards with relative timestamps ("just now", "yesterday", "3 days ago")
- **Bilingual UI** — full Hebrew RTL and English support with `next-intl`

### 8. Electron Shell

- **Window management** — 1200x800 default, 900x600 minimum, draggable title bar region
- **External links** — `shell:open-external` IPC handler for safe link opening
- **Bundled dependencies** — Node.js, Git (dugite), and cc4d skill packaged as extraResources
- **Auto DevTools** — developer tools open automatically in non-packaged builds

---

## Architecture

```
desktop/
├── electron/
│   ├── main.js              # Electron main process (IPC, window, project mgmt)
│   ├── preload.js           # Context bridge (window.electronAPI)
│   ├── preload.ts           # Type declarations for electronAPI
│   ├── project-store.js     # electron-store wrapper for project metadata
│   └── project-utils.js     # slugifyIdea, deduplicatePath helpers
├── src/
│   ├── app/
│   │   ├── api/agent/route.ts   # Next.js API route → Claude CLI spawn
│   │   ├── welcome/page.tsx     # Project selection / creation
│   │   ├── build/page.tsx       # Main chat + build interface
│   │   └── ship/page.tsx        # Deployment flow
│   ├── components/
│   │   ├── chat/                # 9 chat sub-components
│   │   ├── debug/               # Debug terminal overlay
│   │   ├── brand/               # Logo, LanguageToggle
│   │   └── progress/            # StepIndicator, PhaseLabel
│   └── lib/
│       ├── store.ts             # Zustand state (messages, project, streaming)
│       ├── agent-client.ts      # SSE client + event parser
│       ├── activity-blocks.ts   # Message → activity block grouping
│       ├── use-chat-persistence.ts  # Load/save hook
│       ├── renderer-logger.ts   # Console patching for log forwarding
│       ├── debug-store.ts       # Debug terminal state
│       └── use-debug-shortcut.ts    # Cmd+Shift+D handler
├── messages/
│   ├── en.json                  # English translations
│   └── he.json                  # Hebrew translations
└── __tests__/                   # Unit, component, and E2E tests
```

---

## Dependencies Added (since initial commit)

| Package | Purpose |
|---------|---------|
| `react-markdown` | Markdown rendering in assistant messages |
| `remark-gfm` | GitHub-flavored markdown (tables, strikethrough) |
| `vitest` | Unit + component test runner |
| `@vitest/coverage-v8` | Code coverage |
| `@testing-library/react` | Component testing utilities |
| `@testing-library/jest-dom` | DOM assertion matchers |
| `@testing-library/user-event` | User interaction simulation |
| `@playwright/test` | E2E browser testing |
| `jsdom` | DOM environment for tests |

---

## Known Limitations (v0.1.0)

1. **macOS only** — no Windows/Linux testing or packaging yet
2. **No live preview** — browser preview panel removed in favor of single-column chat
3. **No deployment integration** — ship page exists but deployment flow not wired to a provider
4. **No auto-update** — no electron-updater configured
5. **No code signing** — macOS builds will trigger Gatekeeper warnings
6. **Claude CLI required** — expects `~/.local/bin/claude` to be installed separately
7. **Port conflict** — Next.js dev server on 3456 may conflict if not cleaned up on exit
8. **No offline mode** — requires internet for Claude CLI communication

---

## Build & Run

```bash
cd desktop
npm install
npm run dev          # Dev mode (Next.js + Electron)
npm run package      # Production build (macOS)
```

---

## What's Next (v0.2.0 candidates)

- Live browser preview (split pane or floating window)
- Vercel/Netlify deployment integration
- Auto-update via electron-updater
- Windows + Linux support
- Project rename / delete from UI
- Import existing project directory
- Onboarding tutorial / tooltips

lines: +## v0.1.0 Summary
-- **התקנה ידנית** — אין auto-update, אין code signing. משתמשים מתקינים ידנית מקובץ .app
-- **תמיכה רק macOS** — אין Windows/Linux בגרסה הזו
-- **תמיכה רק ב-Opus** — Claude CLI רץ עם model ברירת מחדל (Opus), אין בחירת model בממשק
-- **תהליך Planning עובד** — החלק הראשון של cc4d (steps 1–3): orient, gather idea, define vibe — עובד מלא דרך ה-desktop app שמשלים את השלבים האלו ומעביר ל-step 4
-- **תהליך Execution opinionated** — Step 4 (scaffold-and-build) מריץ `npx create-next-app` עם Tailwind + shadcn ובונה גרסה ראשונה לפי ה-vibe שנבחר, ללא בחירת stack ע"י המשתמש
-- **Agentation וסיבוב פידבק** — Steps 5–6 (react-and-iterate + save-progress): לולאת פידבק שבה המשתמש נותן הערות וקלוד מתקן, כולל git commit אוטומטי
-- **Soul Voice (by Shaul)** — `references/voice.md` — מדריך הטון של המוצר, בהשראת שאול אמסטרדמסקי. "חם, ישיר, קצת צינוקי, אף פעם לא מטיף." כל הטקסטים user-facing עוברים דרך ה-voice guide
+- **Manual installation** — No auto-update, no code signing. Users install manually from a .app file
+- **macOS only** — No Windows/Linux support in this version
+- **Opus only** — Claude CLI runs with the default model (Opus), no model selection in the UI
+- **Planning flow works** — The first part of cc4d (steps 1–3): orient, gather idea, define vibe — fully functional through the desktop app which completes these steps and hands off to step 4
+- **Opinionated execution** — Step 4 (scaffold-and-build) runs `npx create-next-app` with Tailwind + shadcn and builds a first version based on the selected vibe, no stack choice by the user
+- **Agentation & feedback loop** — Steps 5–6 (react-and-iterate + save-progress): a feedback loop where the user gives notes and Claude iterates, including automatic git commits

+- **Soul Voice (by Shaul)** — `references/voice.md` — The product's tone guide, inspired by Shaul Amsterdamsky's writing style. "Warm, direct, a little self-deprecating, never preachy." All user-facing text follows the voice guide
